title: Array lengths don't support generic parameters.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-const-fn
labels.description: Area: const fn foo(..) {..}. Pure functions which can be applied at compile time.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

body:
**EDIT**: This can now be made to work on nightly compilers, although it's a bit awkward to use. See [this comment](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/43408#issuecomment-917600907).



It would seem that when using size_of in const fn context, it fails to properly compute the size of generic types.

The following function fails 

```rust
unsafe fn zeroed<T: Sized>() -> T {
    // First create an array that has the same size as T, initialized at 0
    let x = [0u8; std::mem::size_of::<T>()];
    // Then, transmute it to type T, and return it
    std::mem::transmute(x)
}
```

The error is the following : 

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `T: std::marker::Sized` is not satisfied
 --> src/main.rs:3:19
  |
3 |     let x = [0u8; std::mem::size_of::<T>()];
  |                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ `T` does not have a constant size known at compile-time
  |
  = help: the trait `std::marker::Sized` is not implemented for `T`
  = help: consider adding a `where T: std::marker::Sized` bound
  = note: required by `std::mem::size_of`
```

This is very confusing because it complains that `T` doesn't have `std::marker::Sized`, even though it does have that bound.

## Meta

rustc_version : rustc 1.20.0-nightly (ae98ebfcb 2017-07-20)
